info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 1:59AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Norton, eastern Decatur and Graham Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 159 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of Lebanon to 4 miles north of Wakeeney. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Norton, eastern Decatur and Graham Counties, including the following locations... Densmore, Penokee and Reager. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northwestern Kansas.
